descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Joe Johnson scored a career-high  27 points, including four in the final 13 seconds, as the  Phoenix Suns snapped a five-game road losing streak with a  110-107 victory over the Orlando Magic.
article.headline: Suns put an end to four-game slide
article.linkText: Suns shine in Orlando, thanks to Johnson, Marion
article.story:
ORLANDO, Fla. (AP) -- Shawn Marion and Joe Johnson made sure that Phoenix's four-game road losing streak ended in Florida.
Joe Johnson

Marion

Marion scored 23 of his 29 points in the first half and Johnson had a career-high 27 as the Suns beat the Orlando Magic 110-107 Friday night. "Shawn got us off to a good start in the first half,'' Phoenix coach Frank Johnson said. "And Joe, you could say, finished it.'' After Orlando's Mike Miller missed a free throw with 37 seconds to go that would've tied the game at 106, Joe Johnson hit four free throws down the stretch to seal the win. "I wasn't nervous or anything,'' Joe Johnson said of his foul shooting. "I didn't think I was going to miss them. I just stepped to the line with confidence. Stephon Marbury added 22 points and eight assists, and his baseline floater with 1:46 remaining gave the Suns the lead for good, 104-103. Suns rookie Amare Stoudemire had 16 points and eight rebounds in his first professional visit to his native central Florida. "The second half, they were doubling (Stoudemire) hard,'' Frank Johnson said. "They were really coming out -- and that's called respect.'' Marion grabbed 12 rebounds, and Joe Johnson and Bo Outlaw both had 10. Phoenix outrebounded Orlando 52-38 -- 18 to eight on the offensive glass -- and had 23 second-chance points to the Magic's 10. Magic coach Doc Rivers anticipated that the Suns would be desperate to stop their losing streak, and Phoenix's 69 first-half points proved him right. It was the most points Orlando had surrendered in an opening half this season and one point short of the most they have given up in any half this season. "I really thought we lost the game in the first half,'' Rivers said. "They came out with an amazing amount of energy that we didn't match, and you have to match that at home.'' Tracy McGrady had 33 points -- his fifth straight 30-point game -- and a season-high 11 assists for Orlando, which had its three-game winning streak snapped. Shawn Kemp scored a season-best 22 points, while Miller added 19 points and 11 rebounds. Orlando, down 77-62 with eight minutes left in the third quarter, put together a rally behind Kemp's best play of the season. Taking advantage of Stoudemire's inexperience, the veteran had seven points as the Magic went on a 26-9 run to take their first lead of the game. Miller's two free throws gave Orlando an 88-86 edge with 36.7 seconds left in the period. The Suns built an early cushion, scoring 12 straight points in less than two minutes to break a 6-all tie. Marion started the burst with a 3-pointer and a fast-break jumper. The Suns scored 36 points in the second quarter on 16-of-23 shooting en route to a 15-point halftime advantage. "This loss right here is a learning experience for this team because we dug ourselves a hole in the first half,'' McGrady said. "A good team like that, you can't do that.'' Marion had 11 points in the period and Joe Johnson nine. Joe Johnson's 3-pointer with 55 seconds left before intermission put Orlando up by a game-high 18 points.

Game notes
In games decided by five points or less, Phoenix is 9-2 while Orlando is 7-9. ... Video replay was used to uphold Marbury's buzzer-beating jumper at the end of the first quarter. ... The Magic have had three three-game winning streaks but have yet to win four straight. ... Joe Johnson's 10 rebounds were a season high.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
